data.title: VS Code Helper Crashing OSx

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
My Mac has been crashing everyday since Tuesday, May 2nd (2017) and the OSx crash reports seem to point to Code Helper:

- Process:               Code Helper [7813]
- Path:                  /Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Frameworks/Code Helper.app/Contents/MacOS/Code Helper
- Identifier:            Code Helper
- Version:               0
- Code Type:             X86-64 (Native)
- Parent Process:        Code Helper [7809]
- Responsible:           Electron [5481]
- User ID:               502
- Date/Time:             2017-05-01 04:00:17.943 -0400
- OS Version:            Mac OS X 10.12.4 (16E195)
- Report Version:        12

- Exception Type:        EXC_BAD_ACCESS (SIGSEGV)
- Exception Codes:       KERN_INVALID_ADDRESS at 0x0000646f6d5f6578 

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: 10.12.4 (Sierra)

Steps to Reproduce: I don't have steps to reproduce since my machine is generally idle late at night when this happens. However, today it just locked up while I was using it and did not produce a crash report. I had to hard boot. I have attached the other crash reports.

[Archive.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/979677/Archive.zip)

data.title: Extension Host Terminated Unexpectedly
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro Insider Preview 16184.1001

Steps to Reproduce: Happens upon opening VSCode

For some reason, the "extension host terminated" error pops up every time I update or reinstall VSCode. Happens with insider version and regular version. 

I've isolated the issue to the package.json file in **C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\git**

I'm not entirely sure why - but when I remove this file & restart VSCode, the error message does not pop up & everything seemingly operates normally. Pretty annoying that I've got to manually go in & remove it every time I update, though. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25241706/25753252/6b9868e4-3180-11e7-9630-871d1559f858.png)

I've only installed one extension: **View in Default Application 3.3.0**. Confirmed the issue persists with or without this extension.

Thanks

data.title: Support terminal bg and fg color keys
data.body: Fixes #24735 --- @aeschli @bpasero please review 😃 Most terminal emulators support this, this will allow putting a very high contrast background (due to wide variety of colors like dim/bright white and black) or just styling the terminal differently to the rest of the UI. For example a powershell user might like a terminal with a blue background.

data.title: Add section "OS specific properties" to debugging documentation
data.body:
Add a section "Operating System Specific Properties" to the Debugging documentation (after https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/debugging#_variable-substitution).

This can be based on (copied from) https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks#_operating-system-specific-properties. But we do not want to use a link to the task docu here because users should not need to jump around for this and we want to use debugging specific examples.

data.title: Environment variables in path are not expanded in integrated terminal or Code-launched command prompt

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1607 14393.969

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Have node installed and on your path.
2. Launch integrated terminal (PowerShell).
3. Type `node`, press enter.

The terminal output is `node : The term 'node' is not recognized [...]`.

Recognition of `node` still fails if I instead first enter `cmd` (which works and opens a subshell) and try it there.

**More details**

Also occurs for `npm` and `nvm`, but *not* for `git`. Built-ins and other standard things (like `dir`, `cmd`, `notepad`, etc) work fine.

I use nvm-windows. It's managing 7.4.0 and 7.9.0 for me. This behavior happens when using either.

*Was* occurring in non-integrated CMD and PS terminals until I restarted my computer. *After* restarting my computer, non-integrated terminals do not show this behavior (and so are a workaround for me right now). I had not restarted my computer since initially updating from 1.11 to 1.12.0 a few days ago, and I hadn't tried any of this since before that.

data.title: Find dialog gets in the way too often

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.1 (1.12.1) f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b 2017-05-04T21:15:47.800Z
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit->Find
2. type text and hit ENTER
3. editor finds code, start typing as if to change the code, but find dialog still gets the keyboard input

I have come to expect that when you open a find dialog and type text and hit enter, that the focus goes back into your code so you can edit what you find. I don't mind the find dialog staying up, but compared to all other editors I use on MacOS, I find myself fighting with the find dialog way too much. Love the entire VSCode editor.

data.title: Issue: Select element border radius and color
data.body: - VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:18:32.269Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0 Honestly a super small issue from the looks of it. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Set colors for (Color should have enough contrast between each other to be able to illustrate issue ``` "workbench.colorCustomizations": { "focusBorder": "#a3a3a3", "dropdown.border": "#00FF00" } ``` 2. Click on a dropdown then click off of it as such - You can see in the [colors reference](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/theme-color-reference#_dropdown-control) that the dropdown has `border-radius: 0` - On macos, it does not appear to be the case - The select did not change when I tried to set the `border-radius` to `0` through the inspector.

data.title: Add glob pattern matching to `when` clause, when contributing menus

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.4

In [vscode-java](https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/159), we'd like to be able to provide context menus for *all* gradle files. The current `when` clause is limited to language types (`"when": "resourceLangId == groovy"`) or a single file name (`"when": "resourceFilename == 'build.gradle'"`). 

It would be helpful if there was support for glob pattern matching, as @jrieken mentioned in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3192#issuecomment-226234085

data.title: HTML custom tag has wrong color when name partially overlaps with standard tag
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Win 10 Version 1703 64b

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create an HTML (Angular template) file
1. type a custom component tag, whose name starts with a known standard HTML tag, e.g. some `<form-field>` tag.

### Exptected

`<form-field>` should all be formatted in one color, the same applied to HTML standard tags.

### Actual

`<form` half has same color as standard tag, while the rest, `-field>`, is colored as an attribute:

![edit component html - client - visual studio code](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3185573/25749705/c0044482-31af-11e7-9096-b8d114f5f7a8.png)

data.title: [Feature Request] CheckJS configure NODE_PATH variable
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: OXS El Capitan (probably doesn't matter)

The `"javascript.implicitProjectConfig.checkJs"` is awesome, but in our project, we use `NODE_PATH` a lot to make requiring local dependencies easier. For instance, instead of doing `require('../../util/logger')`, we would just do `require('util/logger')`. In TypeScript, I'm able to make this module resolution work with the following in my tsconfig.json file:
```json
    "baseUrl": ".",
    "paths": {
      "*": ["*"]
    }
```
(This assumes that NODE_PATH is set to the root directory of the project, where tsconfig.json lies.)

I was wondering if something similar was available/coming for JS checks? Right now I'm getting lots of red lines in my imports, and everything is type any.

Git: open file in diff view title bar should always open in the same editor group

data.title: window.zoomLevel should affect the menus
data.body: Everything is scaled by system DPI which is great. In constrast, everything except for the menus is also scaled by `window.zoomLevel`. It would be awesome to have consistency between menus and everything else.
